name: Plaid
slogan: Infrastructure and API's to power FinTech
description:
Plaid is focused on democratizing financial services through technology. We build beautiful consumer experiences, developer-friendly infrastructure, and intelligent tools that give everyone the ability to create amazing products that solve big problems.

We started out by building the technical infrastructure APIs that connect consumers, traditional financial institutions, and developers. Today, we add key insights to the data access we provide with our suite of analytics products.

For more info, visit us at http://plaid.com

jobs.title: Application Security Engineer
jobs.description:
At Plaid, we believe that the way consumers and businesses interact with their finances will drastically improve in the next few years. Our goal is to build the tools and infrastructure for developers to create this next generation of financial services applications. Today, hundreds of companies such as Coinbase, Stripe, and Venmo rely on Plaid to integrate with banks and the financial system.

In this role, you’ll ensure that new and ongoing product work launches with security in mind. You will conduct security reviews of existing products, help craft a long term security architecture strategy with the engineering organization, and help make sure teams are using the right security solutions when required. You will continually improve Plaid’s baseline security by adding new tooling to our deploy process, hooking into existing product reviews, and helping design new security APIs for engineers.


What Excites Us
- A strong background in security architecture, threat modeling, and security review.
- Experience conducting security audits, pentests, etc.
- Able to work cross-functionally with engineering teams to understand potential security issues, and work closely to fix them.
- You can help teams understand how to prioritize security work in line with Plaid's larger business needs.
  


What Excites You
- Helping define the security culture for a rapidly growing engineering organization.
- Creating ways to continually abstract away core security concerns from engineers to speed up development velocity.
- Thinking of security as an enabling function instead of a blocking function.
- Teaching other engineers how to proactively think about the security of their products during the scoping and building phases.


We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

jobs.title: Commercial Counsel
jobs.description:
At Plaid, you will work at the intersection of technology and finance on disruptive innovations that require creative and pragmatic legal solutions. You will join a small but talented team of lawyers. We deal with novel issues every day that will give you an opportunity to work collaboratively across Plaid’s compliance, product, and business teams, as well as with our customers and partners. 

The primary focus of this role is commercial contracts, but you will have opportunities to learn about and assist on a variety of legal matters, including matters relating to data licensing, data security, privacy, patents, trademarks, and open source software.


What Excites You
- Drafting and negotiating agreements of all types, including complex data licensing agreements, innovative partnership deals, and long-term bank relationships
- Designing, building, and improving legal department processes as we scale
- Collaborating on a wide range of regulatory, privacy, consumer protection, intellectual property, and other legal issues that shape our business and the entire FinTech ecosystem


What Excites Us
- 5+ years of experience drafting, negotiating, and advising on M&A or similar corporate deals and/or a variety of commercial deals such as cloud software sales, reseller agreements, and distribution partnerships
- Experience with privacy, data security, and intellectual property law is a plus
- Excellent writing, oral communication, and organizational skills
- Eager to learn about new and emerging technologies
- Comfortable navigating complicated and nuanced legal issues
- JD degree, admitted to the California bar in good standing (or will be able to meet the eligibility and employment requirements of the California bar as a registered in-house counsel), exceptional academic credentials


We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

jobs.title: Consumer Product Marketing Manager
jobs.description:
At Plaid, our mission is to empower innovators by delivering access to the financial system. Since 2012 we've helped tens of millions of consumers live a better financial life and over a thousand customers build a new financial future. Our customers range from startups like  Stripe, Coinbase and Square to Fortune 500 enterprises like American Express and PayPal. Founded in 2012, Plaid has raised $300M of capital from major venture capital firms such as Kleiner Perkins, Andreessen Horowitz, Index, Spark and NEA, as well as global financial institutions such as Goldman Sachs and Citi. But we’re just getting started.

To further this mission, we’re looking for a Consumer Product Marketing expert with experience bringing widely adopted products to a consumer market. You will be responsible for launching Plaid’s first set of consumer products and in that way, have tremendous impact.  Through close collaboration with the consumer product management team, you will surface audience insights that inform the roadmap and leverage those to build scaled go-to-market campaigns that encourage adoption of those solutions. We are looking for someone to build a consumer brand and product experience that positions Plaid as a responsible steward of consumer data and advocate for connectivity.


What excites us
- 8+ years of direct to consumer marketing experience 
- Superior skills in consumer insights/analytics, strategy building, and detailed execution
- Can influence and guide a large cross functional team and align them to the common goal 
- A strong communicator, storyteller and presenter who will present to and interact with senior management, both internal and external 
- Extensive experience managing and optimizing media (advertising) budgets to drive measurable performance, including utilizing advanced analytics


What excites you
- Working in close partnership with our consumer product team, and helping translate its vision into product experiences that delight and surprise a consumer
- Helping build the Plaid brand
- Managing product launches, customer engagement and feedback, collateral development, and scaled customer communication
- Working with customers and partners to execute co-marketing campaigns
- Partnering with Product, Design, Sales, Growth, and Support teams to gather feedback on products and performance
- Working closely with the Product team to understand and influence roadmaps


We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

jobs.title: Corporate FP&A
jobs.description:
Plaid’s mission is to empower innovators by delivering access to the financial system. Using our industry-leading platform, developers can interact with end-user financial data to build the next generation of financial applications. Our products allow businesses to improve conversion, verify ownership and identity, assess risk, and reduce fraud. Our customers range from startups like Stripe and Coinbase to Fortune 500 enterprises like American Express and PayPal.

Founded in 2012, Plaid has raised over $300M of equity capital from major venture capital firms such as New Enterprise Associates, Kleiner Perkins, and Andreesen Horowitz as well financial institutions such as Goldman Sachs, Citigroup, and American Express.

Plaid’s Finance team builds the financial infrastructure to enable sustainable, scalable growth and to ensure attractive long-term economics. As the second FP&A hire, you will work closely with the Head of FP&A to build the team and strategy from the ground up, lead financial forecasting and reporting, and partner with senior leaders across the business to ensure Plaid achieves its short and long-term financial objectives.


What Excites You
- Partner with the Head of FP&A to design and lead all aspects of consolidated forecasting and reporting up to the Executive team and Board of Directors
- Partner with leaders across the entire organization to develop strategy and corresponding financial targets
- Regularly track and manage the investments/spend that fuel continued growth
- Own and improve upon Plaid’s integrated 3-statement financial model that underpins FP&A’s core deliverables
- Design monthly and quarterly financial reports and dashboards with actionable insights and KPIs for Plaid’s leadership
- Implement systems and processes to scale planning & reporting across teams and geographies


What Excites Us
- 6+ years of experience in finance organizations demonstrating increasing levels of responsibility
- Prior Corporate Finance role at high-growth SaaS or platform companies, ideally pre-and post-IPO
- Ability to build strong relationships, influence decisions, and drive alignment on financial targets
- Expert modeling skills, including buildout of full-company operating and financial models
- Strong familiarity with FP&A systems (e.g. Anaplan) and experience with Netsuite and Salesforce
- Working knowledge of US GAAP
- SQL experience is a plus


We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

jobs.title: Design Manager - Design Systems
jobs.description:
We're convinced that the way consumers interact with their finances will drastically improve in the next few years, and we believe that customers building on Plaid’s technology will be the ones to lead that change. As Plaid grows, we need designers who can take the foundations of our design system, Threads, and build it out to work flexibly across different audiences, geographies, and media. 

As a Design Manager at Plaid, you'll be essential in helping to grow the team, nurture our designers, work cross-functionally, and ensure that we ship the best-in-class design experiences.

Learn more about how we created our design system and the process behind designing Link.


What excites you
- A design team that combines the best of embedded and centralized models to create a holistic, world-class experience
- A team that values high quality, pixel-perfect work and delightful interactions
- A fast-paced, product-minded culture that rapidly moves from creative concepts to concrete solutions
- A design culture where talking to customers and users sits at the forefront of every project
- Close collaboration with engineering, business, and other product teams to create a design system that works cohesively—but flexibly—for all of our audiences
- Identifying research opportunities to assess user needs and the quantifiable value of the design system
- Establishing the processes by which our design system is iterated on, expanded, and adopted across teams 
- Collating design requirements and understanding its impact on existing products
- Regularly reviewing work and providing feedback to other designers
- Unblocking your teammates, organizing our work, evolving our process, and generally making things ‘go’
- Organically supporting our team and company culture
- Making Plaid a fulfilling place to work for everyone around you


What excites us
- Past experience leading and managing teams
- The visual know-how and desire to delight the user and deliver a world-class experience
- An appetite for cross-platform collaboration
- A record of leveling up your reports and providing individuals with meaningful opportunities for growth
- A strong penchant for utilizing user research and metrics to guide design decisions
- An ability to advocate for, and be a strong representative of design
- Excellent communication and writing skills
- Experience with working cross-functionally, especially with product and engineering teams
- Excitement for recruiting and a thoughtful approach to identifying new talent


We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

jobs.title: Engineering Manager
jobs.description:
We believe that the way consumers and businesses interact with their finances will drastically improve in the next few years. Our goal is to build the tools and infrastructure for developers to create this next generation of financial services applications. Today, thousands of companies such as Acorns, Stripe, and Venmo rely on Plaid to integrate with banks and the financial system. Plaid’s infrastructure handles millions of requests per day and thousands of bank integrations. We pride ourselves on maintaining a robust API to support the developers who depend on us and the millions of consumers who use their apps. 

As an Engineering Manager in our Salt Lake City office, you'll lead a team of 10-15 engineers. You'll work closely with product managers and other engineering teams to build and maintain the core integrations into our financial institution partners in the US, while helping build out the framework that keeps all these integrations together. This is the most mission-critical component of our infrastructure and is responsible for connecting millions of bank accounts and billions of transactions to Plaid. 

Our engineering culture is IC-driven. We favor bottom-up ideation and empowerment of our incredibly talented team. We're looking for managers who will enable our engineers to find innovative solutions to challenges. Finally, you'll work closely with our Head of Engineering and other engineering managers to build an organizational structure and processes that scale as we continue to grow. 

We're guided by our principles including impact, growing together, embracing openness and positivity, inventing tomorrow; we’re looking for leaders who are motivated by those same principles.


What excites you
- Recruiting, growing, and enabling an incredible team of driven engineers who have high expectations around craft, ownership and impact
- Fostering a collaborative culture that embodies our principles and empowers users
- Mentoring and developing your team of engineers; supporting their goal setting and career growth
- Delivering world-class results, while continuously challenging yourself and your team to “make it better”
- Working with other engineer managers and functional leads to set direction for your team, the engineering department, and Plaid as a whole
- Crafting a thoughtful, long-term technical strategy that anticipates future needs


What excites us
- ~4 years of engineering management experience, leading teams of around 10 engineers
- Significant experience as a software engineer
- Willingness to roll your sleeves up and code when needed 
- Passion for cultivating highly functioning teams and organizations
- A record of leveling up your reports and providing individuals with meaningful opportunities for growth
- Excitement for recruiting and a thoughtful approach to headcount planning
- Experience building teams during a hyper-growth phase a huge plus


We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

jobs.title: Enterprise Growth Manager
jobs.description:
At Plaid, our mission is to empower innovators by delivering access to the financial system. Since 2012 we've helped tens of millions of consumers live a better financial life and over a thousand customers build a new financial future. Our customers range from startups like Stripe, Coinbase and Acorns to Fortune 500 enterprises like American Express, PayPal, JP Morgan Chase and Wells Fargo. Founded in 2012, Plaid has raised $300M of capital from major venture capital firms such as Kleiner Perkins, Andreessen Horowitz, Index, Spark and NEA, as well global financial institutions such as Goldman Sachs and Citi. But we’re just getting started. The Growth team at Plaid combines deep technical, product, and industry knowledge to help our customers build and scale amazing applications. We believe that the way consumers and businesses interact with their finances will drastically improve in the next few years. Plaid is looking for an experienced customer-facing leader to manage and grow a team of enterprise account managers who partner with some of the largest names in fintech and financial services. As a member of the Growth leadership team, you’ll play a key role in defining the enterprise Growth strategy, cultivating relationships with key executive stakeholders across Plaid’s largest customers, and executing on expansion opportunities that drive meaningful revenue growth for the company.


What you'll do
- Recruiting, hiring, and developing a world-class team of enterprise account managers to grow our business with Plaid’s largest customers
- Working in a fast-paced, cross-functional environment that is different every day
- Delivering world-class results, while continuously challenging yourself and your team to be more ambitious
- Navigating complicated and sometimes contentious conversations towards win-win outcomes with our customers
- Working with other Growth leadership to set the direction for your team, Growth, and Plaid as a whole
- Plaid’s mission and our ability to enable innovation within financial services


What excites us
- Strong relationship skills, high EQ, and a long term, partnership-oriented mindset
- Demonstrated ability to communicate, present and influence credibly and effectively at all levels
- 4+ years of experience managing and growing a team of top performing contributors
- 8+ years of customer-facing experience working with large, complex organizations
- Extensive experience, and a background in financial services is a strong plus
- Excitement to work in a high-growth environment and to help build processes and tools as needed


We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

jobs.title: General Counsel
jobs.description:
At Plaid, our mission is to empower innovators by delivering access to the financial system. Since 2012 we've helped tens of millions of consumers live a better financial life and over a thousand customers build a new financial future. Our customers range from startups like Stripe and Coinbase to Fortune 500 enterprises like American Express and PayPal. Founded in 2012, Plaid has raised $300M of capital from prominent Silicon Valley investors including Mary Meeker, Andreessen Horowitz, Index Ventures, and Spark Capital, as well as global financial institutions such as Goldman Sachs and Citi. But we’re just getting started.
 
The General Counsel will be responsible for building and empowering our Legal team, setting legal strategy, overseeing key deals and relationships, and serving as a partner to the rest of the company. Plaid has a complex legal function, and your purview will span across product, regulatory, commercial, international expansions, privacy, corporate, IP, employment, policy, and compliance. And beyond just the legal function, we’re looking for a business partner who will have input and influence across the company, and who will serve as a key member of Plaid’s leadership team. 


What excites you
- Build, lead, and manage a high-performing Legal team that aligns with the needs of a rapidly growing, global organization. Likewise, grow and empower an outcomes-oriented Compliance function to match the scale of our business. 
- Oversee and help develop our legal strategy for a wide variety of product, regulatory, and commercial opportunities. 
- Advise our leadership, product, revenue, and other teams, and help us understand when to take risks, how to mitigate them, and when to avoid them. Bring your deep experience and product knowledge to bear to give appropriate recommendations based on the context. 
- Interface with our key partners (including customers, partners, banks, and regulators) to advise on regulatory and privacy-related issues. Collaborate with our policy team to help build and manage our policy and regulatory relationships. 


What excites us
- Passionate individual who believes in Plaid’s mission and the positive impact that a consumer-centric financial system can have on the world. 
- 15+ years of relevant legal experience, ideally gained at a well-regarded law firm followed by senior in-house roles at late-stage technology companies; General Counsel experience is preferred.
- Proven experience building and leading teams in high-growth environments. A strong track record of positive outcomes for those you have hired + managed in the past. 
- Background working in a regulated industry, and the ability to quickly learn the nuances of financial services regulation. Specific financial services experience is preferred but not required. 
- Excellent communication and project management skills, and the ability to work under tight deadlines, sometimes beyond normal working hours. 
- Shipping-oriented mindset, focused on achieving results quickly. 


We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

jobs.title: Growth - Enterprise
jobs.description:
At Plaid, our mission is to empower innovators by delivering access to the financial system. Since 2012 we've helped tens of millions of consumers live a better financial life and over a thousand customers build a new financial future. Our customers range from startups like Stripe, Coinbase and Square to Fortune 500 enterprises like American Express and PayPal. Founded in 2012, Plaid has raised $300M of capital from major venture capital firms such as Kleiner Perkins, Andreessen Horowitz, Index, Spark and NEA, as well as global financial institutions such as Goldman Sachs and Citi. But we’re just getting started.
 
The Growth team at Plaid combines deep technical, product, and industry knowledge to help our customers build and scale amazing applications. We believe that the way consumers and businesses interact with their finances will drastically improve in the next few years.
 
Plaid is looking for an experienced customer-facing professional to manage our relationships with some of the largest names in fintech and financial services. The right candidate is a natural at building strong partnerships and has demonstrated success owning and growing customer relationships (cross-selling/up-selling, increasing utilization) with major enterprises.
 
You will be the primary point of contact for your customers and will work with them on all stages of integrations, scaling, product expansion, and account management to ensure impeccable service and thoughtful guidance on how to get the most out of Plaid’s offerings. You must be motivated and take a hands-on approach to understanding our clients’ businesses, strategic goals and how they define success with Plaid’s solutions.


What you'll do
- Own overall relationship with assigned customers, identifying key stakeholders and building relationships with influencers and the core team interacting with our solutions
- Collaborate closely with Plaid’s implementation team to ensure customer application launches are timely and successful
- Conduct customer health checks, identifying critical goals and key performance indicators to clearly understand and measure client satisfaction
- Engage in regular customer outreach including quarterly review/meetings, ongoing checkpoints and escalations as needed
- Provide consultative guidance on best practices for deep software adoption,  product capabilities and potential application to customer’s requirements
- Enable successful and consistent renewals, as well as identify and execute on new growth and upsell opportunities with customers
- Identify and open up new lines of business within existing client organizations
- Work with our engineering and product teams to translate customer feedback into product insights


What excites us
- A strong business generalist with an acute product sense
- Able to quickly understand new technologies and complex concepts quickly
- Demonstrated ability to communicate, present and influence credibly and effectively at all levels
- 8+ years of relationship management experience in the financial services industry including large enterprise organizations
- Desire to get (more) technical and the ability to learn the ins and outs of Plaid's APIs
- Interest in financial services and technical products; a high degree of intellectual curiosity
- Excitement to work in a high-growth environment and to help build processes and tools as needed
- Ability to work with all types of people and build long-lasting relationships


We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

jobs.title: HRBP
jobs.description:
Plaid’s mission is to empower innovators by delivering access to the financial system. Our customers range from startups like Stripe and Coinbase to Fortune 500 enterprises like American Express and PayPal. 

Plaid’s People team builds the processes and programs to support the entire employee lifecycle, ensuring our teams are engaged, effective, and continually growing. We’re looking for our first HRBP to support Plaid’s east coast office. You’ll develop the talent strategy and advise on all things People for our 100+ person NY office. This is an opportunity to wear many hats, work across multiple functions and have a meaningful impact on our employee’s success.


What Excites You
- Use data and analytics in order to inform key business and talent decisions
- Provide strategic partnership and counsel to the NYC leaders at Plaid
- Create and implement creative and progressive organizational planning tailored to your client groups, addressing retention and development needs
- Support the NYC teams through all People processes including compensation, talent development, performance management, employee relations, organizational design, etc
- Coach, develop and act as a strategic advisor to leaders at all levels
- Keep a finger on the pulse of NY office and champion their unique needs when rolling out new People programs and initiatives
- Identify development, performance, culture and retention needs and implement appropriate strategies
- Handle employee relations and internal investigations with discretion and compassion
- Support People Operations tasks for the NY office as needed


What Excites Us
- 5+ years of experience as an HR Business Partner, ideally in a high growth environment 
- Analytically driven, experienced in utilizing qualitative and quantitative approaches to problem solving and root cause analysis
- Ability to work effectively in unstructured situations with minimal oversight; someone who can proactively uncover problems/opportunities and advise on potential solutions
- Involvement in a variety of people programs and processes (performance management, compensation, coaching, employee relations, organizational design, etc.)
- Low ego; no task is too small to deserve your full effort and enthusiasm 
- Intellectually curious about all things People as well as Plaid’s mission 


We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

jobs.title: Implementation Specialist
jobs.description:
At Plaid, our mission is to empower innovators by delivering access to the financial system. Since 2012 we've helped tens of millions of consumers live a better financial life and over a thousand customers build a new financial future. Our customers range from startups like Stripe, Coinbase and Square to Fortune 500 enterprises like American Express and PayPal. Founded in 2012, Plaid has raised $300M of capital from major venture capital firms such as Kleiner Perkins, Andreessen Horowitz, Index, Spark and NEA, as well as global financial institutions such as Goldman Sachs and Citi. But we’re just getting started.
 
Implementation is responsible for guiding and helping customers integrate with Plaid products and technology. Implementation works closely with Account Management and Solution Engineers, and will also interface with many other teams internally such as Product, Engineering and Support. In this role, you will be responsible for the implementation phase in the customer lifecycle. This stage is incredibly important in the success of our clients, as for many, their Plaid integration is the foundation of their application and / or platform.

You will be an expert in Plaid’s current product offering, learning how to work with and leverage the Plaid API. You’ll work with clients to answer their product or integration questions. When technical issues arise, you’ll leverage internal tools, teams, and resources to ensure customers meet their development / integration milestones. In collaboration with Account Managers, you will support clients as they test, pilot and launch their Plaid integrations. Members of the Implementation team are expected to manage many implementations / customers simultaneously, and to stay up to date on Plaid’s technological improvements and new product offerings.


What you'll do
- Work with companies from all over the financial industry to build out applications or platforms across a variety of different verticals and use cases including (but not limited to), lending, wealth management, financial management, account opening, student loan refinancing, fraud detection, etc. 
- Serve as the lead technical point of contact for clients throughout the implementation phase, tracking progress towards key milestones to ensure successful and timely launches
- Partner with Account Managers and Solution Engineers to support clients in building out end to end workflows that align with Plaid’s best practices
- Support ongoing testing efforts by troubleshooting and providing technical insights
- Work cross-functionally to improve client experience as they build with Plaid, identifying process improvements, as well as capturing, and communicating, customer feedback to our Product and Engineering Teams


What excites us
- 4+ years of experience in a client facing and / or technology focused role
- Experience managing or executing technical projects
- Strong troubleshooting and problem solving skills
- Excellent project management and communication skills
- Proven ability to quickly learn new technologies and understand complex systems (APIs, databases, reporting tools, etc.)
- Continuous desire to improve technical acumen
- Ability to collaborate with different teams and different types of people
- Ability to work under pressure and navigate unexpected roadblocks 


We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

jobs.title: New Business Associate
jobs.description:
Our sales team at Plaid combines deep product and industry knowledge and is focused on bringing Plaid to an ever-broadening set of businesses. Our thesis is that every company in financial services can benefit from better financial technology, and that many industries that don't currently consider themselves to be FinTech actually are. You'll be the one helping us achieve this vision. As a New Business Associate, you'll manage inbound leads and be the first point of contact for most new companies we work with. You'll run the full sales cycle and will work closely with our product, engineering, and growth teams to help customers launch and scale their applications.

What you'll do:

♣	Manage inbound leads and outbound campaigns—and serve as the primary point of contact for new customers
♣	Help new developers get started with Plaid and answer questions about our products
♣	Identify the most promising developers and verticals to help us grow
♣	Work with our product and engineering teams to integrate customer and product feedback

What we're looking for:

♣	Experience working with customers and explaining technical products
♣	Interest in financial services and technical products; a high degree of intellectual curiosity
♣	Excitement to work in a high-growth environment and to help build processes and tools as needed
♣	Desire to get (more) technical and the ability to learn the ins and outs of Plaid's APIs

jobs.title: People Analyst
jobs.description:
At Plaid, our mission is to empower innovators by delivering access to the financial system. Since 2012 we've helped tens of millions of consumers live a better financial life and over a thousand customers build a new financial future. Our customers range from startups like Stripe and Coinbase to Fortune 500 enterprises like American Express and PayPal. Founded in 2012, Plaid has raised $300M of capital from major venture capital firms such as Kleiner Perkins, Andreessen Horowitz, Index, Spark and NEA, as well as global financial institutions such as Goldman Sachs and Citi. But we’re just getting started.

Plaid’s Total Rewards team builds the infrastructure, tools, and analytics to ensure global rewards and recognition at Plaid are positioned competitively and aligned with our internal values.  You will work closely with the Total Rewards Lead to build the team and strategy from the ground up, lead compensation programs, and partner with leaders across the business to ensure our compensation practices are bringing on and keeping great talent at Plaid.


What excites you
- Partnering with Total Rewards Lead to design, implement, and scale all aspects of global compensation at Plaid that effectively motivates and retains great talent across a diverse workforce
- Partnering with leaders across the entire organization to improve upon existing compensation strategy
- Creating a positive compensation experience for our employees that allows them to clearly understand their compensation across the entire employee lifecycle
- Responding to compensation-related data requests from Managers, HR Business Partners, and Recruiters and providing analytics to support strategic decision making
- Building consultative and collaborative relationships with key partners in HR, Recruiting, Finance, and across business leadership
- Regularly analyzing external markets and making recommendations to adjust internal competitiveness
- Owning and improving upon Plaid’s compensation programs including compensation review cycles and bonus programs
- Implementing systems and processes in order to scale compensation practices and programs across the organization
- Partnering with Recruiting and Hiring Managers in the recruiting process
- Partnering with Finance and Business Operations in the annual and quarterly planning process


What excites us
- 5+ years of experience in compensation analyst/consultant role
- Prior Total Rewards experience at a high-growth SaaS or platform companies, ideally pre-and post-IPO, or at a top tier consulting firm
- Ability to build strong partnerships, influence decisions, and communicate complex work in a clear and concise manner across a variety of audiences from our leaders to our employees
- Experience working closely with leadership in the company
- Expert modeling skills and experience with analytics, Excel, PowerPoint and HR Systems
- Experience in one or more of the following compensation disciplines: salary and incentive plan design and administration, sales compensation, international compensation, equity compensation, executive pay
- Broad knowledge of market trends and compliance related issues
- High level of responsiveness, excellent time and deadline management
- Experience working in high performance focused environments and leading programs
- High level of ownerships, organization, confidentiality, attention to detail, and penchant for documentation
- Experience implementing systems is a plus
- Experience with Workday is a plus
- Bachelor’s Degree is required


We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

Our customers range from startups like Stripe and Coinbase to Fortune 500 enterprises like American Express and PayPal. Founded in 2012, Plaid has raised $300M of capital from major venture capital firms such as Kleiner Perkins, Andreessen Horowitz, Index, Spark and NEA, as well as global financial institutions such as Goldman Sachs and Citi. But we’re just getting started.

Plaid’s Total Rewards team builds the infrastructure, tools, and analytics to ensure global rewards and recognition at Plaid are positioned competitively and aligned with our internal values. You will work closely with the Total Rewards Lead to build the team and strategy from the ground up, lead compensation programs, and partner with leaders across the business to ensure our compensation practices are bringing on and keeping great talent at Plaid.

What excites you

  • Partnering with Total Rewards Lead to design, implement, and scale all aspects of global compensation at Plaid that effectively motivates and retains great talent across a diverse workforce
  • Partnering with leaders across the entire organization to improve upon existing compensation strategy
  • Creating a positive compensation experience for our employees that allows them to clearly understand their compensation across the entire employee lifecycle
  • Responding to compensation-related data requests from Managers, HR Business Partners, and Recruiters and providing analytics to support strategic decision making
  • Building consultative and collaborative relationships with key partners in HR, Recruiting, Finance, and across business leadership
  • Regularly analyzing external markets and making recommendations to adjust internal competitiveness
  • Owning and improving upon Plaid’s compensation programs including compensation review cycles and bonus programs
  • Implementing systems and processes in order to scale compensation practices and programs across the organization
  • Partnering with Recruiting and Hiring Managers in the recruiting process
  • Partnering with Finance and Business Operations in the annual and quarterly planning process

What excites us

  • 5+ years of experience in compensation analyst/consultant role
  • Prior Total Rewards experience at a high-growth SaaS or platform companies, ideally pre-and post-IPO, or at a top tier consulting firm
  • Ability to build strong partnerships, influence decisions, and communicate complex work in a clear and concise manner across a variety of audiences from our leaders to our employees
  • Experience working closely with leadership in the company
  • Expert modeling skills and experience with analytics, Excel, PowerPoint and HR Systems
  • Experience in one or more of the following compensation disciplines: salary and incentive plan design and administration, sales compensation, international compensation, equity compensation, executive pay
  • Broad knowledge of market trends and compliance related issues
  • High level of responsiveness, excellent time and deadline management
  • Experience working in high performance focused environments and leading programs
  • High level of ownerships, organization, confidentiality, attention to detail, and penchant for documentation
  • Experience implementing systems is a plus
  • Experience with Workday is a plus
  • Bachelor’s Degree is required

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

jobs.title: Product Manager
jobs.description:
Every day, Plaid helps thousands of developers build a better financial future. You'll be responsible for defining the products that enable Plaid and our customers to shape the future of financial services.  

You'll work with our customers, partners, and end users to understand their needs, prioritize efforts, and deliver the best possible outcomes.  You'll partner with teams across Plaid, especially closely with Engineering and Design, in order to do so.  


What excites us:
- A track record of running through walls to deliver results
- A superlative ability to bring clarity and focus to complex and ambiguous situations
- 5-10 years of total professional experience
- Entrepreneurship, startup, management consulting, or private equity experience a plus


We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

jobs.title: Program Manager, People Development
jobs.description:
Plaid’s mission is to empower innovators by delivering access to the financial system. Our customers range from startups like Stripe and Coinbase to Fortune 500 enterprises like American Express and PayPal. 

Our People and Organizational Development “POD” team aligns the success and growth of our Plaids (aka employees) with the success and growth of Plaid as a company. The POD Program Manager will design and deliver key learning initiatives globally to maximize the impact of Plaids and make Plaid the highlight of their careers.


What Excites You
- Design and deliver ongoing manager development training and resources, aligned to our leadership competencies and values
- Build manager readiness and onboarding program to accelerate managers’ effectiveness
- Design and deliver exciting career development program for Plaids globally
- Create innovative social learning solutions to enable Plaids to learn from one another
- Oversee D&I training approach
- Oversee content development for global onboarding program
- Create “training in a box” content for managers to use for team development


What Excites Us
- 5+ years of experience in Learning or People Development within a tech company
- Strong understanding of current learning theory and best practices, as applied in innovative and fast growing organizations 
- Demonstrated ability to design programs that excite and are valued by learners and the business alike 
- Known as an engaging facilitator and trainer who makes learning both fun and practical, is able to build trust with participants 
- Able to adjust approach and style to meet diverse and changing needs 
- Looks at problems from a systems perspective, addressing multiple ways to drive behavior change (versus a stand alone training) 
- Has a bias for what’s practical and of greatest use for learners and the business, is able to simplify complex concepts so that learners are able to process and apply them immediately


We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status

jobs.title: Revenue Accountant
jobs.description:
At Plaid, our mission is to empower innovators by delivering access to the financial system. Since 2012 we've helped tens of millions of consumers live a better financial life and over a thousand customers build a new financial future. Our customers range from startups like Stripe and Coinbase to Fortune 500 enterprises like American Express and PayPal. Founded in 2012, Plaid has raised $300M of capital from major venture capital firms such as Kleiner Perkins, Andreessen Horowitz, Index, Spark and NEA, as well as global financial institutions such as Goldman Sachs and Citi.

Plaid’s Finance team plays a critical role in intelligently managing our risks and implementing the proper long-term business strategy. The Revenue Accountant will be responsible for ensuring our billing and revenue recognition processes run smoothly and scale with the growth in the business. You will have the chance to serve as a key contributor to a high growth environment and strengthen your business acumen as well as your understanding of revenue operations. The ideal candidate for this role will develop strong working relationships with cross-functional partners to keep the business ahead of emerging accounting issues. This role will initially report to the Head of Accounting.


What Excites You
- Review new customer contracts for revenue recognition considerations
- Own billing and revenue close for Plaid subsidiaries (e.g. Quovo, international subsidiaries)
- Prepare new customer contracts for billing within Plaid’s proprietary billing system
- Partner with billing engineering and product teams to gather requirements for changes to the billing system; collaborate with billing engineering and go-to-market teams to align on priorities
- Maintain comprehensive view of Plaid’s order-to-cash process and constantly seek process improvements
- Collaborate with A/R accountant to ensure timely collections and responses to customer inquiries
- Devise, maintain, and communicate A/R success metrics


What Excites Us
- 3+ years of relevant work experience
- Bachelor’s degree in accounting or related field
- Strong attention to detail
- Strong communication skills
- Experience working in a high-growth environment
- Ability to work independently and as part of a team
- Experience with NetSuite
- High proficiency in Microsoft Excel


We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

jobs.title: Revenue Enablement
jobs.description:
At Plaid, our mission is to empower innovators by delivering access to the financial system. Since 2012 we've helped tens of millions of consumers live a better financial life and over a thousand customers build a new financial future. Our customers range from startups like Stripe and Coinbase to Fortune 500 enterprises like American Express and PayPal. Founded in 2012, Plaid has raised $300M of capital from major venture capital firms such as Kleiner Perkins, Andreessen Horowitz, Index, Spark and NEA, as well as global financial institutions such as Goldman Sachs and Citi. But we’re just getting started.

Revenue Enablement is focused on transforming the way we drive revenue across the our Go-to-Market teams including Business Development, Sales and Growth to provide needs analysis, learning program design, delivery and coaching to take our team performance to the next level.

You'll be the founding member of this function and you'll be focused on maximizing the performance of our revenue teams as well as accelerating the onboarding and productivity of team members.


What you'll do 
- Design, develop, and deliver world class learning programs that are experiential, drive behavior change and increase enablement and performance
- Develop learning curricula that aligns learning and performance strategies
- Facilitate solution, skill and organizational learning programs for our GTM teams, and provide coaching to managers and IC's for continued delivery
- Evaluate the business impact of learning programs through use of learning and performance metrics


What excites us
- Proven track record of working with business leaders to deliver solution/value selling, pre-sales or consulting activities
- 4+ years of Coaching and Project Management experience across a variety of delivery medium
- Proficient in establishing learning and performance metrics and measurements (ROI & Benchmarking)
- Experience in facilitation, training, coaching revenue professionals as well as analyzing business needs and selling value to customers
- Professional with project/program management experience
- Interest in financial services products and a desire to create strategic relationships that help our team succeed
- Excitement to work in a high-growth environment and to help build processes and tools as needed
- Desire to get (more) technical and the ability to learn the ins and outs our APIs
- Communicate and manage program objectives and deployment plan


We'd love to hear from you! Apply via our jobs API (below). Please include a resume, LinkedIn, and a short description of your relevant background and interests.

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

jobs.title: Sales - Enterprise
jobs.description:
At Plaid, our mission is to empower innovators by delivering access to the financial system. Since 2012 we've helped tens of millions of consumers live a better financial life and over a thousand customers build a new financial future. Our customers range from startups like Stripe and Coinbase to Fortune 500 enterprises like American Express and PayPal. Founded in 2012, Plaid has raised $300M of capital from major venture capital firms such as Kleiner Perkins, Andreessen Horowitz, Index, Spark and NEA, as well as global financial institutions such as Goldman Sachs and Citi. But we’re just getting started.

Our Sales team at Plaid combines deep product and industry knowledge and is focused on bringing Plaid to an ever-broadening set of businesses. Our thesis is that every company in financial services can benefit from better financial technology, and that many industries that don't currently consider themselves to be fintech actually are.

You'll be the individual helping us achieve this vision. Your focus will be on generating new enterprise deals and building strong, long-lasting relationships with large companies. You'll be tasked with identifying and closing major deals across verticals in financial services, utilities, billing, insurance, and more.


What you'll do
- Identify potential customers and run the end-to-end sales process
- Build and maintain relationships with enterprises, from executives to product teams and to developers
- Work with our sales and marketing teams to define and execute our sales strategy


What excites us
- Significant experience (7+ years of quota-carrying experience) in a new-revenue role and a strong track record of closing enterprise-level deals (3+ years focused on enterprise customers) with large target customers
- Strong prospecting, qualifying, and negotiating skills; consultative sales approach with a product-centric mindset
- Experience working with sales development and deploying a territory or vertical focused revenue strategy
- Interest in financial services products and a desire to create strategic relationships that help our customers succeed
- Excitement to work in a high-growth environment and to help build processes and tools as needed
- Desire to get (more) technical and the ability to learn the ins and outs of Plaid's APIs


We'd love to hear from you! Apply via our jobs API (below) or send us a note at jobs+sales@plaid.com. Please include a resume, LinkedIn, and a short description of your relevant background and interests.

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

You'll be tasked with identifying and closing major deals across verticals in financial services, utilities, billing, insurance, and more.

What you'll do

  • Identify potential customers and run the end-to-end sales process
  • Build and maintain relationships with enterprises, from executives to product teams and to developers
  • Work with our sales and marketing teams to define and execute our sales strategy

What excites us

  • Significant experience (7+ years of quota-carrying experience) in a new-revenue role and a strong track record of closing enterprise-level deals (3+ years focused on enterprise customers) with large target customers
  • Strong prospecting, qualifying, and negotiating skills; consultative sales approach with a product-centric mindset
  • Experience working with sales development and deploying a territory or vertical focused revenue strategy
  • Interest in financial services products and a desire to create strategic relationships that help our customers succeed
  • Excitement to work in a high-growth environment and to help build processes and tools as needed
  • Desire to get (more) technical and the ability to learn the ins and outs of Plaid's APIs

We'd love to hear from you! Apply via our jobs API (below) or send us a note at jobs+sales@plaid.com. Please include a resume, LinkedIn, and a short description of your relevant background and interests.

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

jobs.title: Sales - Enterprise (Banking)
jobs.description:
At Plaid, our mission is to empower innovators by delivering access to the financial system. Since 2012 we've helped tens of millions of consumers live a better financial life and over a thousand customers build a new financial future. Our customers range from startups like Stripe and Coinbase to Fortune 500 enterprises like American Express and PayPal. Founded in 2012, Plaid has raised $300M of capital from major venture capital firms such as Kleiner Perkins, Andreessen Horowitz, Index, Spark and NEA, as well as global financial institutions such as Goldman Sachs and Citi. But we’re just getting started. 

Our Sales team combines deep product and industry knowledge and is focused on bringing Plaid to an ever-broadening set of businesses. Our thesis is that every company in financial services, and most specifically the Banks themselves, can benefit from better technology and access to data. 

We’re building a team to work exclusively with the leading banks throughout North America to help enable their transformation to deliver incredible digital and consumer experiences to their customers, at the scale and quality needed by the largest banks.  

Your focus will be on developing & leading large, complex new enterprise deals and building strong, long-lasting relationships with the banks to execute on their vision. Furthermore, you'll help shape how we engage, design and build products for the best brands in banking.

- Build and maintain relationships with enterprises, from executives to product teams and to developers

jobs.title: Sales Engineer
jobs.description:
At Plaid, our mission is to empower innovators by delivering access to the financial system. Since 2012 we've helped tens of millions of consumers live a better financial life and over a thousand customers build a new financial future. Our customers range from startups like Stripe, Coinbase and Square to Fortune 500 enterprises like American Express and PayPal. Founded in 2012, Plaid has raised $300M of capital from major venture capital firms such as Kleiner Perkins, Andreessen Horowitz, Index, Spark and NEA, as well as global financial institutions such as Goldman Sachs and Citi. But we’re just getting started.

Sales Engineering is responsible for demonstrating to prospective customers how Plaid’s solutions will address their business needs. In addition to partnering closely with Account Executives, Sales Engineers also interface with Product Management, Engineering, Operations and Marketing. The Sales Engineer is a highly visible technical and product expert in the pre-sales process, and a primary driver for internal advancement of customer requirements. 

You’ll work closely with our Sales team as the technical lead during the pre-sales process. You will be responsible for partnering with Account Executives, proactively pushing deals forward by overcoming technical objections and building solutions around Plaid products. You will ensure a successful transition to the post-sale stage of the customer lifecycle and partner with Growth to drive adoption of new products by existing customers. You will be expected to have significant knowledge of the Fintech ecosystem and a deep understanding of how clients can best utilize Plaid.



What you'll do
- Serve as the lead technical product contact for prospects throughout the sales process
- Partner with Account Executives to demonstrate to prospects how Plaid can best address their use cases and technical requirements. Specifically, to design solutions and share best practices throughout the sales process.
- Provide ongoing solutions consulting to existing Plaid customers to enable upsells. 
- Work with our engineering and product teams to translate prospect feedback into meaningful product insights


What excites us 
- 3+ years of sales engineer experience and customer facing experience along with a strong sense of customer empathy
- A background that combines business experience and technical acumen
- Strong communications skills with a confident and proactive approach to client management
- Ability to quickly understand new technologies and complex concepts quickly
- Knowledge of web services, APIs, and related standards such as HTTP and REST


We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

jobs.title: Sales Manager - Mid-Market
jobs.description:
At Plaid, our mission is to empower innovators by delivering access to the financial system. Since 2012 we've helped tens of millions of consumers live a better financial life and over a thousand customers build a new financial future. Our customers range from startups like Stripe and Coinbase to Fortune 500 enterprises like American Express and PayPal. Founded in 2012, Plaid has raised $300M of capital from major venture capital firms such as Kleiner Perkins, Andreessen Horowitz, Index, Spark and NEA, as well as global financial institutions such as Goldman Sachs and Citi. But we’re just getting started.

Our Sales team at Plaid combines deep product and industry knowledge and is focused on bringing Plaid to an ever-broadening set of businesses. Our thesis is that every company can benefit from better financial technology and that many industries that don't currently consider themselves to be fintech actually are.

To that end, hundreds of companies such as Robinhood, Acorns, Stripe, and Venmo and a growing number of Fortune 50 companies choose Plaid to deliver a best-in-class experience to integrate with banks and the financial system so that they can create the next generation of applications. Plaid has built integrations allowing access to all of the financial data you need through a single point of integration.

But we’re far from done. We’re looking for a proven sales leader, who will report to the Head of Sales, who has experience in managing a team of Account Executives who are tasked with generating growth across key client segments for Plaid’s suite of financial tools. You’ll play a key role as you build and lead this highly visible, motivated team that generates revenues and achieves individual, team and organizational quotas.


What excites you
- Recruiting, hiring, and developing a world-class sales team to support the revenue targets for the business
- Building and executing on pipeline with new clients and partners to run the end-to-end sales process
- Working in a high-pace, cross-functional environment that is different every day
- Delivering world-class results, while continuously challenging yourself and your team to be more ambitious
- Working with other sales leadership and vertical leads to set direction for your team, sales, and Plaid as a whole


What excites us
- 4+ years of experience building and leading high-performing sales teams with a proven track record of success in a similar enterprise environment
- 5+ years of quota carrying technology sales experience as an individual contributor
- Excitement for recruiting and a thoughtful approach to team planning and development
- A strong track record of negotiating, structuring and executing complex sales agreements
- Interest in financial services products and a desire to create strategic relationships that help our customers succeed
- Strong ability to articulate contractual, technical, and financial value points to customers, including executive leaders
- Outstanding communication and presentation skills with experience managing the sales cycle from business champion to the C-level executives

jobs.descriptionHtml:
At Plaid, our mission is to empower innovators by delivering access to the financial system. Since 2012 we've helped tens of millions of consumers live a better financial life and over a thousand customers build a new financial future. Our customers range from startups like Stripe and Coinbase to Fortune 500 enterprises like American Express and PayPal. Founded in 2012, Plaid has raised $300M of capital from major venture capital firms such as Kleiner Perkins, Andreessen Horowitz, Index, Spark and NEA, as well as global financial institutions such as Goldman Sachs and Citi. But we’re just getting started.

Our Sales team at Plaid combines deep product and industry knowledge and is focused on bringing Plaid to an ever-broadening set of businesses. Our thesis is that every company can benefit from better financial technology and that many industries that don't currently consider themselves to be fintech actually are.

To that end, hundreds of companies such as Robinhood, Acorns, Stripe, and Venmo and a growing number of Fortune 50 companies choose Plaid to deliver a best-in-class experience to integrate with banks and the financial system so that they can create the next generation of applications. Plaid has built integrations allowing access to all of the financial data you need through a single point of integration.

But we’re far from done. jobs.title: Security Compliance
jobs.description:
The Risk team at Plaid is a cross functional team with deep product and industry knowledge, that designs and maintains controls to mitigate risks, ensure trust in the platform, and enable the business. 

Plaid sits in the middle of this ecosystem, and we're the gateway used by our customers to build, test, launch, and scale amazing FinTech applications. In this role, you will be responsible for assessing the design and effectiveness of Plaid’s internal controls that ensure privacy, security, and availability of our API and related underlying infrastructure through internal audits and risk assessments. You will also be the primary point of contact for external security assessments and audit engagements by our enterprise customers and banking partners, working cross functionally with our account management and business development teams.


What Excites You:
- Being part of a highly evolving cross functional team in a rapidly growing organization
- Being a trusted partner to product and engineering teams
- Simplifying and articulating deep technical concepts and requirements into easily understood terms
- Translating compliance requirements into operational procedures 
- Building and maintaining highly effective cross functional relationships in an engineering focused organization


What Excites Us:
- Deep understanding of  Information Security risk management concepts from both enterprise and start-up perspectives  (e.g. ITIL Change Management vs. DevOps Continuous Delivery)
- Deep understanding of security assurance and trust frameworks (SOC 2 - AICPA Trust Service Principles, NIST 800-53, ISO2700x, CSA STAR, etc.)
- Strong understanding of different types of application architectures (e.g. monoliths vs service-oriented architecture), and application deployment models (e.g. on-prem vs. cloud)
- Strong understanding of privacy and data protection laws (CCPA, GDPR, GLBA Privacy and Safeguards Rules)
- Proven ability to understand and contextualize complex technical concepts into ELI5 terms
- Strong track record of developing and maintaining high quality internal policy and procedure documents
- Proven ability to manage projects and deliverables to completion with limited direction
- Experience interacting with external auditors and explaining deep technical concepts
- Experience working extremely cross functionally in a fast moving, engineering focused organization


We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

jobs.title: Security Engineer
jobs.description:
One of our main goals at Plaid is to lower the barriers to entry for financial services—and with that comes the responsibility to abstract the most sensitive parts of the financial system for our clients.

We were the first to release account number tokenization through our partnership with Stripe, first to create end-to-end tokenization of consumer financial data, and first to write the spec that several top-five financial institutions are now implementing to permission consumer and business financial data. At Plaid, proper security is an asset and a product, not just something to be scared of.

What excites you:

 - Regularly assessing the threat model for both our existing production code and systems that are in development
 - Having a thorough understanding of our products and implementations to balance the need to increase product development and manage security risk
 - Being an integral part of the engineering team by shipping production-level code while also serving as a security resource to the rest of the team
 - Ensuring our policies and procedures are best-in-class and forward-thinking
 - Handling incident response when a security event occurs
 - Proactively researching new attack vectors as applications and infrastructure changes
 - Developing general techniques and frameworks that will enable other engineering teams to find flaws before they are introduced into production
 - Being responsible for external messaging of security processes and systems and keeping up-to-date with industry developments

jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer - Product Engineering (Financial Identity Team)
jobs.description:
Product engineering teams at Plaid strive to make interacting with financial data not only better but delightful. We believe that the key to solving finance’s biggest problems lies in meeting modern user expectations.  The way we do this is by making access to the financial ecosystem dirt-simple for developers, and in doing so help developers bring unique value to consumers and businesses.

The Financial Identity Team (FIT) is responsible for partnering with clients who need to understand a consumer’s financial identity in order to offer them new financial services. For example, a neo-bank needs to verify the identity of a user that signs up. Once the user signs up, the neo-bank would like to become the users primary bank account by moving their direct deposits, bill pay, etc to this new account. The FIT team makes this easy for developers by handling user authentication, and offering a handful of simple to integrate APIs.

We are looking for engineers who understand what it means to discover, build and iterate on scalable products that power our customers’ use cases.  This means being able to work across the entire stack when needed, collaborating with cross functional partners and setting the long-term technical direction for new products. Our engineering culture is IC-driven—we favor bottom-up ideation and empowerment of our incredibly talented team.  As a result we are looking for engineers who are excited by leading projects through setting technical direction and mentoring those around them. We are looking for engineers who are motivated by creating impact for our consumers and customers, growing together as a team, shipping the MVP, and leaving things better than we found them.


What excites you
- Leading high risk products with real high reward impact: Your work will touch tens of millions of end-users, the best applications in FinTech, and worlds largest financial institutions
- Crafting a thoughtful, long-term technical strategy for Plaid’s new products that anticipates future needs to maximize impact
- Working closely with cross functional partners to dig through finance’s complex challenges—and reimagining the experience completely
- Working on both the 0 to 1 stage and the 1 to 10 stage of problems
- Mentoring other engineers into senior roles and establishing a culture of technical excellence


What excites us
- 8+ years of deep industry experience building and iterating on products for top-tier teams
- Persistent problem solvers with a consistent track record of building interesting projects
- Production experience designing and shipping highly reliable backend systems and APIs
- A record of mentoring experienced engineers around you and helping them grow
- A background in startups is a plus


We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

jobs.title: Software Engineer
jobs.description: The front end engineering team strives to make interacting with financial data not only better, but delightful. We believe that the key to solving finance’s biggest problems lies in meeting modern user expectations. As the gateway for thousands of applications like Robinhood, Stripe, or Venmo, Plaid’s platform calls for innovative problem solvers interested in tackling the complex challenges that exist in the financial ecosystem and scaling developer and user-facing systems to millions of users. To develop top-tier, heavy-UI applications like Plaid Link, we are looking for people who excel across the disciplines of front end engineering. This means a deep understanding of the JavaScript language, full-stack systems, scalability and performance, the nature of the HTTP protocol, and the varied edge cases in browsers, stylesheets, and mobile devices. We are also very open to fully remote, as a large portion of the team is part of a fully remote team. ## What excites you - Working with engineers with an eye for design, and with designers who code - Products with real impact: Your work will touch tens of millions of end users, the best applications in fintech, and major U.S. financial institutions - Interactive single-page applications, built on modern front-end frameworks like React - Data visualization and a fantastic data set to work on - High-performance JavaScript SDKs that can be dropped into third-party applications - Digging through finance’s complex challenges—and reimagining the experience completely ## What excites us - Background in computer science, engineering, or another related field - Persistent problem solvers with a strong track record of building interesting projects - Deep understanding of (and passion for) JavaScript, scalability and performance, HTML, CSS, browsers, stylesheets, and mobile devices - Passion for web projects, backed up by an online presence (e.g., GitHub, Codepen, personal sites) - UI instincts, but not necessarily the ability to create comps from scratch - 3+ years of experience building web applications - A background in startups is a plus **Want to jumpstart your application process? _After completing the application_, take a moment to complete our Coding Challenge**. We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

jobs.title: Software Engineer - Abuse
jobs.description:
At Plaid, we believe that the way consumers and businesses interact with their finances will drastically improve in the next few years. Our goal is to build the tools and infrastructure for developers to create this next generation of financial services applications. Today, hundreds of companies such as Venmo, Coinbase, and Acorns rely on Plaid to integrate with banks and the financial system.

In this role, you will become an owner of Plaid’s abuse infrastructure, and help build APIs that enable engineers to launch new products safely and securely. As Plaid grows, you will ensure that Plaid continues to be protected from emerging abuse vectors. Success means being able to consistently measure and goal against reducing abuse happening across Plaid’s ecosystem.


What excites us
- 3+ years experience building high availability infrastructure to collect signals for understanding and monitoring potential abuse.
- Understanding and prioritizing abuse vectors quantitatively.
- Able to work cross-functionally with teams like compliance, legal, and product to understand potential abuse patterns, and help teams integrate with core abuse infrastructure.
- Successful projects across the engineering stack that tackle fraud, abuse, spam, or trust and safety at scale.
- Experience building, maintaining and understanding the health of your classifiers to automate abuse detection.


What excites you
- Integrating yourself into the product launch process to proactively understand new abuse vectors.
- Creating novel signals to better understand how adversaries are working across Plaid’s ecosystem.
- Working across the stack backend to frontend, as well as on mobile to understand abuse end to end.
- Building APIs for engineers so they can abstract abuse concerns out of their products.
- Helping automate how operation teams review and respond to new or ongoing attacks.


We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

jobs.title: Software Engineer - Growth
jobs.description:
At Plaid, we believe that the way consumers and businesses interact with their finances will drastically improve in the next few years. Our goal is to build the tools and infrastructure for developers to create this next generation of financial services applications. Today, hundreds of companies such as Venmo, Acorns, and Coinbase rely on Plaid to integrate with banks and the financial system.

The mission of the Developer group at Plaid is to enable every business to become a fintech company. As the first growth engineer, you’ll lay the foundations for us to grow our developer base 100x worldwide. You’ll help develop systems and frameworks across Plaid’s web stack and leverage experiments to help drive growth. You’ll also help drive the direction and mentor the existing Growth team on best practices around experimentation. To be successful in this role, you must have strong full-stack development skills, enjoy data-driven development and work well within a small, cross-functional team.


What excites you
- Working closely with product, marketing and data science to define and run A/B experiments that help drive customer conversion
- Implementing systems to support experiments, such as notification and email systems
- Working with design to refine UI and design systems


What excites us
- 5+ years of industry experience building global websites
- Deep understanding of (and passion for) JavaScript, HTML, CSS
- UI instincts, but not necessarily the ability to create comps from scratch
- Experience implementing large-scale email/ad systems
- Experience building metrics-driven experiments and using data to inform product decisions


We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.
